Thank you all for the support and interest in the Starbucks Singapore Planner. However, the planners are no longer available for sale but we have reserved stock for those who still haven't redeemed your vouchers as yet.

Please refer to the link to find out which stores you can redeem your vouchers at: http://bit.ly/starbucksplanner

Die... then lots and lots of people will go in and give 10 cents, 20 cents or $1 or $2 for the drink for charity. Starbucks should just offer a 1 for 1 offer for the charity drive! At least you be guaranteed higher donations for the Salvation Army... :(

Thanks Gabriel... actually I think the best way is for Starbucks to offer one for one drinks vouchers (say $5???) that is valid for one week and sold in favour of the Salvation Army. That way, everyone can take their own time within one week to visit and redeem the drinks and prevent stress on the Starbucks staff too! 11.post_text: A New York Cheesecake for you. And another, on the house, to share with a friend. Day 2 of gifting is here. #12daysofgifting

comments.message: A little disappointed today. Went to your Bedok branch and they were sold out. Just a penny of my thought ：） Shouldn't Starbucks anticipate  BIG crowd for such promo? Shouldn't it be better if there is a sign to inform customers that promo cakes are sold all out than  having us join the long queue giving us the hope to enjoy the gift that can fill our heart with joy?

We Starbucks fans were excited about the Starbucks 12 Days of Gifting promotion. Unfortunately, I was extremely disappointed when I got a stale cheesecake from an outlet at Raffles place this morning. How on earth did the staff serving me not even notice the difference in color? I'm sure you guys are not using this promo as an opportunity to clear stock, so please do something about your expired products.

Dear Starbucks, I would like to echo my disappointment at the substandard packaging of the cheesecakes. Your staff at the citylink mall outlet clearly didn't bother to place cake separators in between the 2 slices and the result, 2 lumpy cheesecakes that are far from presentable. Despite the 1-1 promotion, staff should continue to exercise food preparation and presentation. This is disappointment. The taste is odd too and I echo the other client - we suspect the cheesecake is stale. This doesn't warrant the $6.50, even if it is 1-1. Terrible start to Christmas.
Alvin Lim

I was excited about the cheesecake promotion and went to Starbucks Jurong Point immediately after school to purchase it. To my disappointment, it was out of stock . It would be great if Starbucks would bring in more cheesecakes as it is obvious that there will be a huge increase in sales of cheesecake from this promotion. Also, a sign to notify customers that the cheesecakes are sold out would be very much appreciated.  But the smiley on the cup sure lift my mood. :)
Bought! Thank you :)

Ya, agree with Karen Tong, I was at Nex branch this afternoon n was inform that promo cakes were sold out.. Disappointed as I think Starbucks should have done better to handle the promo.... :(

13.post_text:
Join us in giving back to the needy for the 10th year running with The Salvation Army in Singapore. 

We're celebrating by having our promising local artistes perform at selected stores from today 'til 5 Dec. Say hello, support our talents and donate generously. 

30 Nov, Raffles City: 3pm - Nick Tan, 4pm - Rachael Teo
1 Dec, Liat Towers: 2pm - The Glad Stones
2 Dec, Wisma Atria: 4pm - Michaela Therese
3 Dec, 313 Somerset: 3pm - Charlie Lim, 4pm - The Ukulele Girls
4 Dec, Plaza Singapura: 3pm - Michaela Therese, 4pm - The Ukelele girls
5 Dec, Plaza Singapura: 5pm onwards - 53A, Natalie Hiong, The Ukelele Girls, Vanessa Faith [Music], The Glad Stones and Dawn Ho.

comments.message:
Hey there Queen-Jas Mine, Zill Yvonne Tan, Evon Lim, Jigmey Chunzen and Tay Joo Yong Benson,

Our open house event will be held at all stores on 5th Dec, 5-7pm. During this period, you'll be treated to a tall sized complimentary beverage to savor. However, we'll urge you to donate generously to the Salvation Army.

In the lead up to the 5th, we will also have local talents singing and playing at the stores mentioned in the post. We will also take donations during these performances as well.

We hope to see you guys very soon!

The Costa Rica La Candelilla Estate's bright citrus notes lean towards the sweeter side, finishing with a creamy mouthfeel and chocolate aftertaste. 

Now brewing at Starbucks Reserve.

24.post_text: For a breakfast treat or a mid day pick-me-up - yumminess awaits. Hazelnut Chocolate muffin, Toffee Coffee or Cranberry Orange Slice.
